title: How to unlock a prior Verizon serviced phone, so that it will be compatible with any carrier - Quora

response.answer_text: To add to Alfredo Perez-Davila superb answer, it is possible that the carrier and the phone are incompatible, technologically. Carriers have their own phones manufactured in order to work best with their own network. Even if a phone is unlocked (as all Verizon phones are), it is possible that the hardware in the phone can not work with the new carrier. In that case, there is nothing that can be done to make the old phone work on the new network.

Verizon phones (at least iphones) have been carrier unlocked for a long time, that is they work on any carrier with that carrier’s SIM card, you just have to get it from your carrier. Now, if you are talking about a phone (again, iPhone) that is icloud locked, there is nothing you can do to unlock it unless you are or know the original owner and know the iCloud password.
